subject: linear_algebra
title: Positive Definite Matrices: Characterization and Applications
contentHtml: In linear algebra, a positive definite matrix is a square matrix that has all positive eigenvalues.

problem.statementHtml: Given a matrix A, determine if it is positive definite.
hints: Use the fact that A is symmetric
problem.solutionHtml: To solve this problem, we can use the following steps:
problem.answerShort: Find the eigenvalues and check if they are all positive.

workedExample.problemHtml: Consider the matrix A = [[2, 1], [1, 2]]. Is it positive definite?

steps.explanation: This will help us find the eigenvalues.
These are the solutions to the characteristic polynomial.

steps.description: Check if the eigenvalues are positive
steps.explanation: Since both eigenvalues are positive, we conclude that A is positive definite.

intuition: Positive definiteness is a crucial property in many applications, including machine learning and computer vision.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Positive Definite Matrices
contentHtml: In linear algebra, a positive definite matrix is a symmetric matrix with only positive eigenvalues.

problem.statementHtml: Given a symmetric matrix A, determine whether it is positive definite.
problem.solutionHtml:
Solution:

  • First, check that A is symmetric: \[\mathbf{A}^T = \mathbf{A}\]
  • If A is symmetric, verify that all its eigenvalues are positive: \[\lambda_i > 0, i = 1, \dots, n\]
problem.answerShort: Positive definite if symmetric and all eigenvalues are positive

workedExample.problemHtml: Given the matrix A = \[\begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 1 & 3 \end{bmatrix}\], determine whether it is positive definite.

steps.explanation: We need to verify that the matrix is symmetric.
Since both eigenvalues are positive, A is positive definite.

intuition: A matrix is positive definite if it represents a valid covariance or Gram matrix.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Positive Definite Matrices
contentHtml: In linear algebra, a matrix is said to be positive definite if it satisfies certain properties.

problem.statementHtml: Given a matrix \mathbf{A}, determine if it is positive definite.
problem.solutionHtml:
Solution:

  • Step 1: Compute the eigenvalues of \mathbf{A}.
  • Step 2: Check if all eigenvalues are positive. If not, \mathbf{A} is not positive definite.
  • Step 3: Verify that \lambda_{min}(\mathbf{A}) > 0.
problem.answerShort: Positive definite if all eigenvalues are positive

workedExample.problemHtml: Given the matrix \[\mathbf{A} = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 1 & 3 \end{bmatrix}\], determine if it is positive definite.

steps.explanation: We use an eigendecomposition algorithm to find the eigenvalues.

steps.description: Check if all eigenvalues are positive
steps.explanation: Since both eigenvalues are positive, we can conclude that \mathbf{A} is positive definite.
We can verify this by checking the smallest eigenvalue, which is indeed positive.

intuition: Intuitively, a matrix is positive definite if it represents a real-valued quadratic form that is always positive.
